channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Google pulls AI ad for Olympics following backlash
item.description: Google was criticized for using artificial intelligence to write a fan letter to an Olympic athlete.

item.title: Intel heads for worst day on Wall Street in 50 years, falls to lowest price in over a decade
item.description: Intel shares cratered on Friday, dragging down Asian stocks including Samsung and TSMC as well as other chipmakers.

item.title: Europe stocks close 2.8% lower, extending losses after weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs report
item.description: European markets extended losses Friday after the Bank of England narrowly approved an interest rate cut.

item.title: Kamala Harris' tax records reveal 'fairly basic' approach that may have missed savings, advisor says
item.description: As the de facto Democratic nominee, Vice President Kamala Harris' financial records are under fresh scrutiny. Here's what to know about her tax returns.

item.title: Ex-Google engineers who founded Character.AI re-join company with new AI partnership
item.description: One of the founders previously criticized the tech giant for moving too cautiously to release AI products.

item.title: Britain cancels $1.7 billion of computing projects in setback for global AI ambitions
item.description: One of the funding commitments was for the creation of a next-generation exascale computer, which would have boosted the U.K.'s AI efforts.

item.title: The end of the 'carry trade'? How Japan's yen could be ripping through U.S. stocks
item.description: The key driver of global markets is the yen exchange rate, according to one financial historian.

item.title: WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich, ex-Marine Whelan released in U.S., Russia prisoner swap
item.description: The swap of American, Russian and German prisoners is the largest such exchange since the Cold War.

item.title: Age is just a number for this 36-year-old academic who has danced her way to the Olympics
Kamala Harris raised $310 million in July, dwarfing Trump haul for month
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris saw a fundraising boom after President Joe Biden endorsed her candidacy against Donald Trump, the Republican nominee.

item.title: Job growth totals 114,000 in July, much less than expected, as unemployment rate rises to 4.3%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 185,000 in July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: UK lenders slash mortgages as Bank of England rate cut brings relief to homeowners
item.description: UK lenders have begun slashing their mortgage rates in a sign that financial pressure on households may be easing after the Bank of England cut interest rates

item.title: Nvidia reportedly faces a U.S. DOJ antitrust probe after complaints from rivals
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice is investigating complaints that Nvidia allegedly abused its market dominance in AI chips, The Information reported.

item.title: An August stocks slump is ‘absolutely normal’ — but strategists urge caution on buying the dip
item.description: Strategists on Friday urged investors to take a cautious approach to a global stock market sell-off.

item.title: Turkey blocks Instagram throughout country amid complaints of censorship of Hamas-related posts
item.description: The Turkish government did not disclose a reason for the ban nor how long it would be in place.

item.title: Exxon earnings beat as production in Guyana and Permian sets a record
item.description: Exxon Mobil on Friday posted its second-highest results for the second quarter in the past decade, helped by record production in Guyana and the Permian Basin.

item.title: Japan's stock rout shows a 'fundamental shift' is underway, Goldman Sachs' equity strategist says
item.description: On Friday itself, the Nikkei 225 and the Topix indexes saw their worst days since March 2020, falling more than 5%, according to Factset data.

item.title: Nintendo profit falls 55% as sales of its ageing Switch console plunge
item.description: Nintendo sold 2.1 million units of its flagship Switch consoles, down 46% from the 3.91 million units it sold in the year ago period.

item.title: Why all semiconductor firms are not benefiting from the AI boom like Nvidia has
item.description: Not all chip firms are benefiting from the boom in artificial intelligence, earnings show, underscoring the complexities of the semiconductor supply chain.

item.title: Singapore's monetary authority sets up review group in bid to revive its equities market
item.description: MAS said one goal will be to identify methods for encouraging participation, including from capital market intermediaries, investors and listed companies.

item.title: World’s first major AI law enters into force — here's what it means for U.S. tech giants
item.description: The European Union's landmark artificial intelligence law officially enters into force Thursday — and it means tough changes for American technology giants.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei drops 5% to an 8-month low, Topix clocks worst day in 8 years as Asia markets fall
item.description: The gloomy sentiment in Asia markets comes after a sell-off on Wall Street, which saw all three major U.S. indexes plunge on recession fears.

item.title: Ice vests, extra breaks and slushies: Olympians are struggling to keep cool in the Paris heat
item.description: U.S. gymnastics superstar Simone Biles isn't the only Olympian feeling the Paris heat.

item.title: Li Auto's July deliveries hit a record as Chinese EV consumers prefer hybrid options
item.description: The strong deliveries reflected Chinese consumers' persistent concerns about relying only on a battery for driving.

item.title: Here's everything you need to know about Friday's big jobs report
item.description: A gradual slowdown in the economy and Hurricane Beryl are expected to have taken some of the steam out of hiring in July.

item.title: China’s first university degree in marriage offers courses like matchmaking and pre-divorce counseling
item.description: Modules will include sociology, wedding venue design, family ethics, the economics of the marriage industry and family policies.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India's hot deal-making season extend to a free trade agreement?
item.description: India and the U.K. are motivated and see each other benefiting from a deal — but a number of key demands from both stand in the way of a quick agreement.

item.title: Amazon says distraction of Olympics, Trump assassination attempt contributed to weak forecast
item.description: Amazon CFO Brian Olsavsky told reporters after the company's earnings report that "we do see different traffic patterns during those events."

item.title: Intel to cut 15% of workforce, reports quarterly guidance miss
item.description: Intel will say goodbye to 15,000 employees, cut capital expenditures and forgo a fourth-quarter dividend following weak results and quarterly guidance.

item.title: Apple sales rise 5%, topping estimates as iPad and Services revenues jump
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell on Thursday.
